values: This has all gone terribly wrong.

Received an email with this last week and found it worthy of action:

Stop Bill HR875 (Food Safety Modernization Act of 2009) which will criminalize organic farming in the U.S. There is significant effort to move this Bill through Congress quickly before people are aware of what is happening. Under this Bill, the small, independent farmer, including backyard ones (because the language is so broad), could not possibly adhere to the stringent regulations in the Bill.  This Bill imposes fines of $500,000 and confiscation of animals and property if procedures are not followed and chemicals and drugs are not used.  If this Bill is passed, farmers would be told what to feed and how to medically treat the animals.  Additionally, heirloom seeds?those best suited for each area passed down by families from generation to generation?would be replaced with ?federally-sanctioned seeds? requiring toxic fertilizers and pesticides.

Bill HR875 was introduced by Congresswoman Rosa DeLauro whose husband Stanley Greenburg is a political consultant for Monsanto, a leading producer of herbicide glyphosate ("Roundup"), genetically-engineered seeds as well as developers and marketers of bovine growth hormone.  Additionally, Bill HR875 is backed by Monsanto and doesn?t actually mention the word ?organic? in it; therefore, it is extremely important to bring this to the attention of your representative.

The latest major action was April 23 and is now referred to the House subcommittee on Livestock, Dairy and Poultry. Take action now and contact your state representative via e-mail (www.congress.org) or phone at 202-224-3121 and ask them to oppose HR875 and related bills (S 425).  Ask friends and family to do the same.  The future of the food supply for us and future generations is at stake.

Spend 1 minute and 40 seconds to view this video clip for a quick summary: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epXNJNjYBvw or continue to research online.

For access to Bill HR875, especially Section 3-Definitions, the link is:  http://www.govtrack.us/congress/billtext.xpd?bill=h111-875

With Gratitude, Health and Happiness -

Dawn Miskus FP07

P.S.  Additionally, there are several petitions on the internet for signature.  Here is the link to one: http://www.leavemyfoodalone.org/


Also a very good Blog on the Bill as well: Stop Bill HR875 (Food Safety Modernization Act of 2009) which will criminalize organic farming in the U.S. There is significant effort to move this Bill through Congress quickly before people are aware of what is happening. Under this Bill, the small, independent farmer, including backyard ones (because the language is so broad), could not possibly adhere to the stringent regulations in the Bill.  This Bill imposes fines of $500,000 and confiscation of animals and property if procedures are not followed and chemicals and drugs are not used.  If this Bill is passed, farmers would be told what to feed and how to medically treat the animals.  Additionally, heirloom seeds?those best suited for each area passed down by families from generation to generation?would be replaced with ?federally-sanctioned seeds? requiring toxic fertilizers and pesticides.

Bill HR875 was introduced by Congresswoman Rosa DeLauro whose husband Stanley Greenburg is a political consultant for Monsanto, a leading producer of herbicide glyphosate ("Roundup"), genetically-engineered seeds as well as developers and marketers of bovine growth hormone.  Additionally, Bill HR875 is backed by Monsanto and doesn?t actually mention the word ?organic? in it; therefore, it is extremely important to bring this to the attention of your representative.

Dawn Miskus FP07

How many more warning signs do we have to see to realize we need to do something NOW?!

Rules and regulations exist solely due to ignorance and no other reason. If you feel trapped by the sorry state that society has slipped into, there is only one way to make it right. Educate yourself and as many people as you can. Stop making excuses for your ignorance and start doing something about it. Don't become dependent on others choosing your actions (and thoughts) for you. Start asking why and don't take "because we said so" as an answer. We mustn't become a slave of traditions, after all no progress is made if everything stays the same.

This is your life, start taking control of it.
It'd be funny if it weren't true...

It's funny in away. America votes for change and all it gets is another puppet. Why don't they just stop lying to us and put down what we really are voting for: 4 more years of Corporate Enslavement.

Look around, does this feel like freedom to you?

Victimless crimes are a form of revenue.

We are forced to pay for services we don't need.

We fear the fear itself.

Who are these people we put upon the pedestal and worship? Why are they so special? Why would you give up your rights to people you don't even know.

America has been taken hostage and is now suffering from Stockholm syndrome. These people rob us blind, bind us, and rape us and we speak so highly of them and we ask for more. All the while, we say how great it is to be free.

When were we ever free?

One things for certain, we will never get anywhere with the level of ignorance in this nation, no, this is far beyond our nation... This is the entire human race at this point.

Here in America we rather make laws to "protect" the ignorant rather than inform them. This is the most frustrating, asinine, way of dealing with an issue. Why should I have to suffer for other's shortcomings? Better yet why is it OK to be stupid?

No more excuses. Admit your failures and learn from them. Just because we are an imperfect race doesn't mean we should celebrate our shortcomings. Stop laying down for the weak and instead teach the weak how to be strong. This is the only road to freedom from stupidity, freedom from those who wish to take advantage of our ignorance, those who have taken us hostage....

"It's a waste of a vote."

I'm so sick of hearing these ignorant words. Through the years I've heard many people utter these very words when someone actually decides to vote for the person they truly believe should be the next President of the United States of America. It's like a plague.

Let me put this in perspective for you, The only wasted vote is a vote for someone you do not truly want as a leader. Failure to do so is what is bringing our country to ruin. It's a matter of statistics, if everyone votes for who they think is going to win, and not who they want to win, the results of the vote are going to be obviously (and terribly) skewed.

It's time for you to think for yourself. Don't worry about who everyone else is voting for, focus on who you, and only you, really trust leading us for the next 4 years and beyond. Do some research into the candidates, this entails a little more than just watching the news, but, it doesn't take much time. This is for your benefit after all. If you aren't willing to help yourself don't expect anyone else to.

This is our country! Let's keep it that way!
Spread the word. Let this be the medicine that cures the plague of a country lead by ignorance and controlled by greed. Freedom is our responsibility to defend and uphold. Don't let anyone change that.
-Joseph L. Grencho

Here;s a report from AOL on the matter: http://news.aol.com/political-machine/2008/01/02/ron-paul-cut-from-debates/#cont

CNN: http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/12/31/debate.limits.ap/


 Maybe Ron isn't going to win the election, but he does bring many valid topics into the debates and considering how much money he has raised, I think he deserves to be on this debate. FOX has made terrible mistake excluding Ron at such an early time especially right before the NH primary.

I'm posting this here so it can hopefully help someone out in the future.

It seemed that every time the computer would try to do anything thing somewhat HDD intensive The computer would go terribly slow and the sound would be so garbled and chopped up that it made using any media program a measure in futility.


After suffering through two months of terribly distorted, choppy sound and slow overall performance, I have found the solution which is a mere three steps. The following is based on Windows XP on a HP Pavilion ZD8000CTO but may work for other PCs.

Step 1
go into your device manager(right click My Computer>Properties>Hardware>Device Manager) and look up "IDE ATA/ATAPI Controllers" and double click on the "Primary IDE Chanel" and remove it.

Step 2
Restart and enter BIOS and Reset your BIOS to factory settings. I'm not going to go through how to do this just look it up if you don't know how. it very simple.

Step 3
Let the computer reinstall it's Drivers and restart after it's completed. Enjoy your undistorted music and faster performance.

Why this works is for some reason the computer switches how it controls it's IDE devices from DMA to the, outdated and slow, Prepared I/O or "PIO" . This is what causes distorted sound and sluggish performance. deleting the driver and reseting the BIOS restore your IDE back to being controlled by DMA the way they are meant to.

It's been awhile sense I've posted anything of real value on here, but I want to bring forward a severe problem in this country: The lack of formal driver training. Imagine the disaster that would happen if we gave pilots a rulebook, a really short flight test and then handed them a card and said, "You're ready to fly!"

"Why is driver training an important invest for America?", you might ask. In a country where cars are depended upon heavily it'd be nice to know that all the other drivers out there are fit to drive, wouldn't it? Well it's obviously not the case. As an example, the first day it snowed this season I counted at least 6 vehicles on I-91 spun around in the center median at different places This was within 10 mins maybe less and there was less than 1 inch of snowfall. The first car i spotted was a Jeep Wrangler which is, obviously, a capable vehicle in the snow (if you know how to use it). I got off I-91 shortly after almost being struck by someone in Expedition. All these accidents could have been avioded if the person driving knew exactly how to operate the car they were driving.

Now here's the root of the problem, this people were never taught how to drive, they were taught the rules (if that!) and handed the keys. Most people don't know the basics of automobile handling. I'm going to cut to the chase it's plain as day that it's a problem and here's how to solve it: Mandatory driver training in schools that actually teaches you the logistics of driving a car, what to inspect on your car frequently, and what to do during emergency situations, not just how to obey the law. Start this early in a child's life too. Despite several reports of lawmakers wanting to raise the legal driving age to lower accidents. Believe me this is the last thing we really need. The reason why Teens crash so much is because they lack experience in driving. Raising the legal age is just going to push the age of people who crash up because they are still going to be just as inexperienced. Even more so because the older you get the harder it is for you to learn. If kids start learning how to drive at a younger age they'll be more capable at driving, not to mention their progress can be tracked easier making it easier to judge weather or not they are ready to hit the road or require more training or, perhaps, aren't capable of operating a motor vehicle at all. Most of all Responsibility will be learned, something that many of my fellow Americans have lost sight of, as of late.
